newsitem.title: USA: Continental pilots to picket in Newark.
newsitem.headline: Continental pilots to picket in Newark.

text.p: Continental Airlines Inc. pilots, who are in contract negotiations with the nation's fifth-largest airline, said Tuesday they will conduct "informational picketing" this week at Newark International Airport in New Jersey.

The pilots said they will picket and distribute material that explains their position in the labour negotiations, which began April 2. The pilots plan to picket in Cleveland and Houston later this month.
"This is simply informational picketing and has no impact on our operations," said Ned Walker, a spokesman for the Houston-based carrier.
The union's public statements "don't reflect the progress being made at the bargaining table," Walker said.
The Independent Association of Continental Pilots said the picketing was part of its effort to secure an "industry standard" contract for its members. The pilots' contract became amendable June 30.
Earlier this month, Continental said the pilots' demands would cost $1.4 billion over three years.

The airline also said the pilots have received about $100 million in wage adjustments in the past two years, through two wage increases and $30 million in lump-sum payments. The pilots union, however, said pay levels still remain below industry averages.
Talks between the pilots and the airline were scheduled to resume Tuesday and continue for the rest of the week, the pilots union said.
Continental's class A stock fell 37.5 cents to $35.75 on the New York Stock Exchange.
